conclusion: Analyze the processes in the p-V diagram to determine heat absorbed and released.
Cycle consists of adiabatic expansion, isochoric cooling, adiabatic compression, and isochoric heating.
Process b → c is adiabatic expansion.
Process c → d is isochoric cooling.
Process d → a is adiabatic compression.
Process a → b is isochoric heating.
Adiabatic processes involve no heat exchange (Q = 0).
Adiabatic processes b → c and d → a do not contribute to heat absorbed or released.
Isochoric cooling involves constant volume and pressure decrease, leading to temperature decrease.
During isochoric cooling c → d, heat is released (Q released > 0).
Isochoric heating involves constant volume and pressure increase, leading to temperature increase.
During isochoric heating a → b, heat is absorbed (Q absorbed > 0).
Net heat exchange depends on magnitudes of heat absorbed and released during isochoric processes.
Pressure difference during isochoric heating a → b is smaller than during isochoric cooling c → d.
Heat absorbed during a → b is less than heat released during c → d.
Final conclusion: Heat absorbed is less than heat released during the complete cycle.
